summary: Sorry, I should've been more specific. I meant separate from the series.  Could you write about Harry introducing Y/N to his...
question: Sorry, I should've been more specific. I meant separate from the series.  Could you write about Harry introducing Y/N to his friends but they're caught off guard by Y/N addressing Harry as daddy. Then one of his friend's asks him about it he explains how they met.
answer:
Love this concept 💞💞 so cute.
Y/N addresses Harry as daddy while she’s meeting his friends & Harry explains

____

“It’ll be okay, bubba,” Harry kissed Y/N’s forehead before knocking on Liam’s front door.

She’d been worrying so much. What if they don’t like me, daddy and do I have to meet them, daddy leaving her lips every minute.

Her hand squeezed his when she heard the door knob being messed with and finally the door was pulled open.

“Yup! It’s them!” The blonde man called over his shoulder. “Welcome. It’s not my house—it’s Liam’s, but welcome,” he laughed, stepping aside. “I’m Niall. It’s nice to meet you,” he stuck his hand out.

“You too,” Y/N forced out as she shook his hand.

The greetings went smoothly (even though Y/N was freaking out in her head the whole time.)

The first time she said it was when Harry offered to take her coat.

“Here, let me hang that up for you, lovey,” he hummed.

“Thanks, daddy,” she smiled as she took off her coat and handed it to Harry.

The body brushed it off though, thinking it was a causal nickname or meant to be a funny tease.

Eventually they were sat talking, waiting for the food to be done.

“Uhm, daddy? Where’s the bathroom?”

“Right down the hall—here, I’ll take you, baby. Come on,” he stood from his seat and did the ‘come here’ notion with his ring covered fingers. She grabbed his hand and soon they walked away.

He left her in the bathroom before returning to his friends, and his drink.

“Why does she keep calling you daddy?” Niall chuckled.

“What do you mean?” Harry was confused for a second. Of course she’d call him daddy. Why wouldn’t she call him daddy? He’s her daddy, after all.

“She keeps calling you daddy? It was cute the first time but now it’s getting a bit weird,” Liam mumbled.

“Ohhhh, no—she’s like—that’s our relationship,” he explained, laughing a little. “She calls me that all the time. We have a dom and sub relationship—‘m her daddy.”

“Harry….” Niall began before laughing. “Y’can’t be serious, mate.”

“I am,” Harry’s eyebrows furrowed.

“But how can you find love that way? You said you were in love with her, mate?” Liam asked.

“I am. She’s an amazing person, Liam. She’s sweet, she’s funny, she’s really fucking kind,” he listed. “The list goes on.”

“How’d you even meet her?” Louis asked.

Harry smiled. “We met at a coffee shop actually. You know how I just moved right?”

They all nodded.

“Well, I’d seen her there a few times, studying away or having coffee with her friends—sometimes alone while watching videos on her phone. She would always laugh at them and I never knew what she was watching until she told me—they were funny cat videos,” Harry laughed to himself. The two often sit and watch them together—it’s kind of their thing.

“And so I started going there more often, to see her. And I noticed she ordered caramel coffee’s every time—after noon. Before noon she would get caramel macchiatos. And so I ordered the same thing as he once—it was after noon, like one, so I ordered a caramel iced coffee, and when they called hers I went for it and said I ordered the same thing. Then I asked her if she was busy, so I could sit with her. And well, the rest if history.”

“Aw, daddy, you remember,” he heard, then smiled.

“Course I do, bubs,” he looked over his shoulder and reached for her. She walked towards him with a smile, putting her hand in his and when she was close enough he kissed the back of her hand and pulled her closer. She sat beside him and he kissed her cheek. “ m’ sweet little girl, aren’t you, bubby?”

summary: How would Harry react to one of his family members posting  a picture of yn at a family gathering and she’s pregnant but they’re...
question: How would Harry react to one of his family members posting  a picture of yn at a family gathering and she’s pregnant but they’re yet to announce it to the media?
answer:
Not too long. Hope you like it love! 💞
Here’s, Y/N’s family member accidentally posts a picture of a pregnant Y/N, when it was supposed to be a secret
____
Y/N’s face was clearly swollen (her cheeks were chubby and her nose had grown a bit) and her arms were a bit chubbier, and her tight black dress showed her small but noticeable four (almost five) months pregnant belly.

She was smiling for the picture, her head on Harry’s shoulder because they sat beside one another at the dinner.

Harry has news notifications on (not for any celebrities accept for his wife, he wasn’t into the gossip but liked to have the updates on his girl, especially when he was away from her and they didn’t get to communicate as much as they usually do.) So when he woke up (she was asleep beside him, her belly poking out from underneath her shirt.) He smiled and kissed her bump, then her forehead before he reached for his phone to turn off the extra alarm he has set in case he misses the first one.

Only he found several notifications. Notifications telling him that his wife was pregnant. Notifications from various news networks and magazines.

This confused Harry because so far, the only people who knew she was pregnant was her immediate family and his. And they were both told to keep it a secret.

Maybe paparazzi got a picture of her while she was out? Harry clicked one of the man notifications to check out the proof they had on their very true claim.

It was the picture from dinner last night.

And the screenshot was an Instagram post. Posted by Y/N’s brothers wife.

Harry was immediately livid.

He was waking Y/N up in a matter of seconds.

“Hm?” She hummed tiredly, eyes shut still.

“Baby, you have to wake up.” He felt bad waking her. She values her sleep (especially nowadays.) But he had to.

“What happened?” She opened her eyes slowly before gasping. “Did my water break?”

Harry couldn’t help his laugh at how adorable she was. “No, love. Y’water didn’t break, y’barely five months, lovey.”

“Then what, Harry? I was having a really good dream,” she pouted, laying her upper body onto his.

“Which was?” He asked, his fingers gently combing through her hair while she laid her head on his chest.

“We were on the beach, and I was skinny, and you were saying how much you loved the way my eyes looked in the sun, and you were just about to start feeding me strawberries—ugh,” she whined at how amazing and euphoric her dream had been before it was interrupted.

Harry laughed. “I’ll feed yeh some strawberries later today, hm?”

She nodded. He kissed the top of her head and rubbed her back. “Anyway, love. Back to what I woke you for,” he spoke. “Y’brothers wife posted that picture from last night—“

Y/N gasped. “From dinner? The group one?”

“Yes and everyone knows you’re pregnant—I just wanted to make sure you know that I’m about to call her and tell her what an idiot-“

“No, you are not,” Y/N stated sternly.

“She ruined our secret! We kept it a secret for a reason! Your safety is at risk. The baby’s safety. Everything—“

“I know, Harry but I’m sure she just didn’t realize when she posted it. I’ll call my brother and ask him to get her to delete it, okay?”

“Well it’s too late now,” Harry grumbled.

Y/N sighed. “Is it that noticeable?”

“Yes.”

She pouted. “I wanted to be the one to tell anyone.”

“I mean, I think if we just lay low until the baby is born we can just pretend like we don’t know a thing. It’ll still be a surprise to everyone. They’ll have forgotten about it by then.”

Y/N nodded. “You’re right.”

“Now,” Harry patted her hip. “Call her right now before I do.”

“Yes and everyone knows you’re pregnant—I just wanted to make sure you know that I’m about to call her and tell her what an idiot-“

“No, you are not,” Y/N stated sternly.

“She ruined our secret! We kept it a secret for a reason! Your safety is at risk. The baby’s safety. Everything—“

“I know, Harry but I’m sure she just didn’t realize when she posted it. I’ll call my brother and ask him to get her to delete it, okay?”

“Well it’s too late now,” Harry grumbled.

Y/N sighed. “Is it that noticeable?”

“Yes.”

She pouted. “I wanted to be the one to tell anyone.”

“I mean, I think if we just lay low until the baby is born we can just pretend like we don’t know a thing. It’ll still be a surprise to everyone. They’ll have forgotten about it by then.”

Y/N nodded. “You’re right.”

“Now,” Harry patted her hip. “Call her right now before I do.”

summary: Haze 2 Saturday The flowers on the glass over the dinning table were withering, the vanilla candle hadn’t been lighted, there...
body:
Haze 2

Saturday

The flowers on the glass over the dinning table were withering, the vanilla candle hadn’t been lighted, there were no crumbs on the kitchen counter. You took a crumpet out of the freezer and tried to make one of those fruit shakes yourself- strawberries, blueberries and banana would have to do the trick. You were pretty sure lately he had been adding almonds- or was it cashew nuts?- but you didn’t risk it. Maybe you could text him? But then again he hadn’t come back home last night. 

Jeff had made a bed for him at the attic- he had just covered the couch with sheets- but he didn’t care for he hadn’t really slept at all. He didn’t think it was possible not to sleep one single minute when one was lying on a bed all night but it turned out once again he was wrong and then he couldn’t stop thinking about all the times he had been wrong in his life. He had been wrong when he was seven and he had stolen that one tale about that bunny who wasn’t good at Maths from the school library and he had been wrong when he was thirteen and he had made fun of Gemma after her performance at the school graduation party. He had been wrong every single time he had lied to his mum and he had been wrong when he didn’t make it on time on one of your dates. He was wrong when he forgot to do the dishes, he had been wrong when he didn’t call you that one time before his concert in Melbourne even though he said he would. He had been wrong when he dismissed your insecurities about Ursula and instead of making you feel like you had nothing to fear, he simply ignored your jealousy and thought you were just beeing needy. He was wrong when he didn’t try to change your mind last night. 

You had made way too much smoothie- enough for two people- so you threw the rest down the sink because you remember Harry saying you have to drink it as soon as it’s made, baby, because otherwise the fruit falls to the bottom and it looks disgusting. You found yourself staring at Harry’s mug. It was so Harry- not necessarily the mug but the fact that he would use that old mug you had got him on your trip to Scotland two weeks after you started dating, instead of any other fancy, way better mug from that home deco shop he liked so much. But that was the thing about Harry- he could have anything in the world and still he would never change that special pillow for bad backs your mum had gotten him for Christmas for any other fancy pillow in the world, just because that pillow had been given to him by your mum, just like the mug had been given to him by you. Looking down at your belly, you wondered if that part of him would also rather have you all fat and swollen over any other model he could easily snap a finger and have. 

Sunday 

He had gone out for lunch with James and Julia after his friend’s many complaints about how long it had been since last time they had seen each other. Julia suggested he could write a letter to you and maybe never send it, but just write down all the reasons why you should want to raise a child with him. He ordered a quesadilla, instead of the salad with chicken and raisins he usually had, just because he thought you would have made fun of him for going to a Mexican place and order a salad he could easily make at home. 

If you were having a baby you were sure he must be really sad in there because you hadn’t stopped crying all day long. You had woken up with a headache and you had looked to your left, ready to tell Harry so he could make it better, only to find the blank spot and all those pictures of the two of you you had stuck to the wall last time he had been gone for tour. He used to call it the memorial wall and he used to stick candid polaroids of you every time he was home. You wondered how the memorial wall would look like with a scan of the baby on it and then with polaroids of a little one with a chin dirty on mashed veggies. Your lips curled up in a smirk when you thought about how healthy Harry’s purées would be for the little one. You have to eat it as soon as it’s made, baby, because otherwise the leek  falls to the bottom and it looks disgusting.

Monday

14. I am very good at board games, so they would love rainy days with dad. 

15. I make a killer pumpkin soup.

16. I used to be baker, so no problem with birthday cakes, birthday cupcakes for school… I know I haven’t baked in a while but you know what they say- once a baker, always a baker. 

Gemma had been texting you pictures of bouquets all morning. You wondered if she was texting Harry too. Show them to my brother please. You frowned at that. He hadn’t told her and he had done the right thing- this was her wedding, she didn’t have time to worry about your fight over a baby bump. And talking about the bump, you’d have to send your dress to a tailor. You texted Harry the bouquet pictures. I think roses are prettier than peonies. 

Tuesday

Gemma had just left Jeff’s apartment. She had called Harry at least 35 times but he had not picked up once. She probably knows and who wants to talk about it? So she had called you and then she had called Jeff and then she had come and had scolded and hit Harry as he covered his junk with a pillow. And you know what? She’s right, roses are prettier than fucking peonies. He sighed, lying on the couch and hoping to God Gem would say you had said yes. 

You opened the door on your tracksuit. Gemma didn’t even ask as she made her way inside your apartment. 

“Would you like some tea?” You whispered. 

“No.” She snapped. “I don’t have time for tea. Y/N, I know my brother is an idiot. Lord knows I’ve spent my entire life telling him just that but I’m about to get married and here’s what I hope- that my future husband loves me half as much as my brother loves you. That would be enough.” 

“Green or white tea?” 

“Y/N!” She yelled. 

You turned around, frowning for Gemma had never, ever, raised her voice at you or even argue with you for the smallest of things. 

“Listen to me!” She yelled again. “Our cook’s wife called saying he’s depressed, Mike’s dad’s cat passed away last night and my wedding dress doesn’t fit because my fucking bum got bigger even thought I’ve been eating celery for a week, so I’m hungry, I’m mad and I’m worried and tomorrow we’re having a nice dinner party so Mike and I can fucking relax and you both are going to be there, do you hear me? You both! And you would be happy and smiley and you would not let my mother know any of this or I would have both your fucking brainless heads on a tray for my wedding day!” 

You nodded, your lips parted and your brows furrowed over your nose as she took deep breaths and gathered her blond hair on a ponytail. 

“And I will have a lime blossom tea, please.” 

You nodded and a second later you placed the tea in front of her, making another one for yourself before you sat down next to her. 

“You should probably have chicken too, otherwise you’d retain fluids and get more swollen. I mean, in between the celery meals.” 

She bursted out laughing. 

Wednesday night

You weren’t sure who was going to get there first but you just hoped for your sake Gemma had placed name tags on your seats so you didn’t have to go through the disappointment of seeing Harry sitting next to someone else. 

He was standing, not far from the table, when he saw you walking in. It must be true- what they said that women only became prettier when they were pregnant- because you looked like you just came out of a dream. You smiled timidly at those who greeted you and from his spot next to his cousins he could see you were sad and shy and somewhat still scared. He hated to see you like that- he wanted to change everything in the world so you would never be afraid again- but he also remembered it had been his job to make you feel safe and fearless- at least when it came about family- and he had failed you so he was very surprised when you made your way towards him without hesitation the moment your eyes met his. 

“Hello.” You smiled timidly. 

“Hi.” He smiled, relief washing over his very soul as soon as he heard your voice. 

“Is your mum here already?” 

So that was the reason you had come to him- so she wouldn’t know. 

“Yeah.” He nodded. 

Before he could say anything else, people started making their ways inside from the balcony and taking their seats on the long table. You looked at the plates- no tags, great. Harry was still standing next to you, probably fighting the same hesitation so you gave him a soft smile when you noticed how tensed his shoulders were. He was about to start sweating, you could tell, and he had been glancing timidly at you for the last two minutes so you decided to start the conversation. 

“Is this seat taken?” You smiled softly, pointing at an empty chair next to the one he was standing behind. 

“No.” He smiled. 

“Well can I sit next to you?” 

“You can always sit next to me.” He smiled. “Anywhere.” 

Dinner started and finished smoothly. Gemma had cried at least four times and Mike had made a toast for his father’s cat but other than that, dinner had started and finished smoothly. Harry had been taking small sips from his glass of wine, purposely bringing the glass to his lips so he could miss the refills while you had been casually sipping on your water, your wine glass untouched. He discreetly changed your wine glasses after he was done with his and you chuckled lightly as you realized how careful he was with every little detail, as if somebody would suspect of a pregnancy just because you weren’t having wine. He smiled. 

“Can we talk?” He asked. 

You simply nodded and followed him out to the balcony, where he took a seat on one of the empty tables. He had surely closed the whole hotel restaurant for his sister and you smiled as you took a seat next to him. Both of you watched the London lights from afar. 

“I am very sorry for doubting you.” He sighed. “I can’t believe I thought the baby wasn’t mine.” 

“Me neither.” You chuckled. 

“I’ve been thinking about a little girl just like you but even shorter” You swatted his arm, half amused at his teasing as he smirked “running down the hall and making everything into a mess.” 

“Just like her daddy then.” You teased and he rolled his eyes. “I hope he has your eyes though.” 

“I don’t.” He smiled, staring into your eyes with a smile on his face. “I’m really sorry.” 

“I know.” You nodded. “I’m sorry too, you know. I mean we’ve been together for two years now and God knows how insistent” you chose- instead of annoying as fuck so he swatted your arm because he knew what you meant “you’ve been with all that communication shit and the first important decision we have to take together I go and not even tell you about it.” You shook your head. “So I’m sorry about that.” 

“I’m sorry you felt like you couldn’t tell me.” He added.

“That’s not your fault.” You bit your bottom lip and he nodded. 

“You know I love you right?” He took your hand in his, caressing his thumb over the back of your hand as you gave him a sweet smile. “You’re the love of my life and” he chuckled when he caught the way your eyes sparkled at his words “I know you’re too good for me but that’s why I’ll spend every day of my life trying to make that up to you. I just… Listen I know sometimes things are hard between us, I travel a lot and you… You have to stay home so you can do your thing but for me there’s nothing in this world worth losing you so… If I have to give up anything, that chair you don’t really like, the house in LA,” he joked “my job… I would do that. I will do anything for you and our baby.” 

“I would never ask you to do that.” You frowned. “I don’t want you to. One of the reasons I fell in love with you was because of your passion for music. I will never stay in your way.” He nodded. He knew. “Listen” you sighed “I don’t know how my baby is going to be” You shrugged “Whether he’d be tall or short, nice or naughty, whether he’d have brown eyes or green, curly or straight hair… But what I do know is that they will have the best dad in the world.” 

He chuckled as he wiped away his tears and then he wrapped his arm around your shoulders and pressed a kiss to your temple, still softly crying after his forehead had rested on the top of your head. You whispered I love you and your breath his his chest. He knew he was the luckiest man alive. 

“You’re really having my baby.” He chuckled. 

“I am.” You grinned. 

“You, Y/N Y/L/N, are going to be the best mum in the world and I’m so lucky both of you are mine.” He smiled. 

“I’m terrified.” You giggled, tears streaming down your cheeks and he chuckled as he wiped them away, pressing soft pecks all over your face in between big smiles. 

“You don’t have to have my baby now if you don’t want to.” He whispered. 

“I just don’t wanna mess them up.” You giggled or sobbed- you were not sure what was going on inside your mind. 

“How could you possibly mess anyone up, love?” He pecked your nose. “This… This might not be the best time but, uh, if we decide it is the right time, I’ll just take a break” he shrugged “for a couple years but, really baby, you gotta trust me and you gotta talk to me and if you do not want to be a mum just yet or ever” he raised his eyebrows “that’s okay too. You know when I said there was nothing in this world worth losing you, I meant it so just… Don’t be afraid to think out loud with me. I won’t judge you, baby, I know this age gap we’ve never really talked about hasn’t been important to us so far but I guess if I think back about me being 21 and I think about having a baby then… Well, I don’t know if I would have wanted that.” 

“I mean it might not have been intentional” You started, raising your eyebrows but he was already smiling because he knew that look “but… I’ve also been thinking lately about a little one with curly hair and green eyes, I think we could name him Robin” His smile widened at your suggestion as he nodded “and… I also kind of like the idea of being possibly one of the youngest moms in school, I think it’d make me kind of cool.” You narrowed your eyes, pursing your lips and making him laugh. 

“Kind of cool? Are you gonna try to be one of those cool mums” his fingers drew the quoation marks on the air as you smiled “that embarrass their teenage sons when his mates are over by trying to talk about cool things because they’re still young?” 

“That was so Anne, wasn’t it?” You smiled. 

“Oh, boy, you will be one of those.” He shook his head. “Hey, bug, you’re lucky I’m here to help you with this one.” He whispered, his eyes burning your belly and you rolled your eyes. 

“I’m so happy it’s you.” You grinned, looking at him. 

“I’m happy it’s you too, lover.”

He knew. “Listen” you sighed “I don’t know how my baby is going to be” You shrugged “Whether he’d be tall or short, nice or naughty, whether he’d have brown eyes or green, curly or straight hair… But what I do know is that they will have the best dad in the world.” 

He chuckled as he wiped away his tears and then he wrapped his arm around your shoulders and pressed a kiss to your temple, still softly crying after his forehead had rested on the top of your head. You whispered I love you and your breath his his chest. He knew he was the luckiest man alive.

“I am.” You grinned. 

“You, Y/N Y/L/N, are going to be the best mum in the world and I’m so lucky both of you are mine.” He smiled.

“You don’t have to have my baby now if you don’t want to.” He whispered. 

“I just don’t wanna mess them up.” You giggled or sobbed- you were not sure what was going on inside your mind. 

“How could you possibly mess anyone up, love?” He pecked your nose. “This… This might not be the best time but, uh, if we decide it is the right time, I’ll just take a break” he shrugged “for a couple years but, really baby, you gotta trust me and you gotta talk to me and if you do not want to be a mum just yet or ever” he raised his eyebrows “that’s okay too. “I’m happy it’s you too, lover.”

Haze 2

Saturday

The flowers on the glass over the dinning table were withering, the vanilla candle hadn’t been lighted, there were no crumbs on the kitchen counter. You took a crumpet out of the freezer and tried to make one of those fruit shakes yourself- strawberries, blueberries and banana would have to do the trick. You were pretty sure lately he had been adding almonds- or was it cashew nuts?- but you didn’t risk it. Maybe you could text him? But then again he hadn’t come back home last night. 

Jeff had made a bed for him at the attic- he had just covered the couch with sheets- but he didn’t care for he hadn’t really slept at all. He didn’t think it was possible not to sleep one single minute when one was lying on a bed all night but it turned out once again he was wrong and then he couldn’t stop thinking about all the times he had been wrong in his life. He had been wrong when he was seven and he had stolen that one tale about that bunny who wasn’t good at Maths from the school library and he had been wrong when he was thirteen and he had made fun of Gemma after her performance at the school graduation party. He had been wrong every single time he had lied to his mum and he had been wrong when he didn’t make it on time on one of your dates. He was wrong when he forgot to do the dishes, he had been wrong when he didn’t call you that one time before his concert in Melbourne even though he said he would. He had been wrong when he dismissed your insecurities about Ursula and instead of making you feel like you had nothing to fear, he simply ignored your jealousy and thought you were just beeing needy. He was wrong when he didn’t try to change your mind last night. 

You had made way too much smoothie- enough for two people- so you threw the rest down the sink because you remember Harry saying you have to drink it as soon as it’s made, baby, because otherwise the fruit falls to the bottom and it looks disgusting. You found yourself staring at Harry’s mug. It was so Harry- not necessarily the mug but the fact that he would use that old mug you had got him on your trip to Scotland two weeks after you started dating, instead of any other fancy, way better mug from that home deco shop he liked so much. But that was the thing about Harry- he could have anything in the world and still he would never change that special pillow for bad backs your mum had gotten him for Christmas for any other fancy pillow in the world, just because that pillow had been given to him by your mum, just like the mug had been given to him by you. Looking down at your belly, you wondered if that part of him would also rather have you all fat and swollen over any other model he could easily snap a finger and have. 

Sunday 

He had gone out for lunch with James and Julia after his friend’s many complaints about how long it had been since last time they had seen each other. Julia suggested he could write a letter to you and maybe never send it, but just write down all the reasons why you should want to raise a child with him. He ordered a quesadilla, instead of the salad with chicken and raisins he usually had, just because he thought you would have made fun of him for going to a Mexican place and order a salad he could easily make at home. 

If you were having a baby you were sure he must be really sad in there because you hadn’t stopped crying all day long. You had woken up with a headache and you had looked to your left, ready to tell Harry so he could make it better, only to find the blank spot and all those pictures of the two of you you had stuck to the wall last time he had been gone for tour. He used to call it the memorial wall and he used to stick candid polaroids of you every time he was home. You wondered how the memorial wall would look like with a scan of the baby on it and then with polaroids of a little one with a chin dirty on mashed veggies. Your lips curled up in a smirk when you thought about how healthy Harry’s purées would be for the little one. You have to eat it as soon as it’s made, baby, because otherwise the leek  falls to the bottom and it looks disgusting.

Monday

14. I am very good at board games, so they would love rainy days with dad. 

15. I make a killer pumpkin soup.

16. I used to be baker, so no problem with birthday cakes, birthday cupcakes for school… I know I haven’t baked in a while but you know what they say- once a baker, always a baker. 

Gemma had been texting you pictures of bouquets all morning. You wondered if she was texting Harry too. Show them to my brother please. You frowned at that. He hadn’t told her and he had done the right thing- this was her wedding, she didn’t have time to worry about your fight over a baby bump. And talking about the bump, you’d have to send your dress to a tailor. You texted Harry the bouquet pictures. I think roses are prettier than peonies. 

Tuesday

Gemma had just left Jeff’s apartment. She had called Harry at least 35 times but he had not picked up once. She probably knows and who wants to talk about it? So she had called you and then she had called Jeff and then she had come and had scolded and hit Harry as he covered his junk with a pillow. And you know what? She’s right, roses are prettier than fucking peonies. He sighed, lying on the couch and hoping to God Gem would say you had said yes. 

You opened the door on your tracksuit. Gemma didn’t even ask as she made her way inside your apartment. 

“Would you like some tea?” You whispered. 

“No.” She snapped. “I don’t have time for tea. Y/N, I know my brother is an idiot. Lord knows I’ve spent my entire life telling him just that but I’m about to get married and here’s what I hope- that my future husband loves me half as much as my brother loves you. That would be enough.” 

“Green or white tea?” 

“Y/N!” She yelled. 

You turned around, frowning for Gemma had never, ever, raised her voice at you or even argue with you for the smallest of things. 

“Listen to me!” She yelled again. “Our cook’s wife called saying he’s depressed, Mike’s dad’s cat passed away last night and my wedding dress doesn’t fit because my fucking bum got bigger even thought I’ve been eating celery for a week, so I’m hungry, I’m mad and I’m worried and tomorrow we’re having a nice dinner party so Mike and I can fucking relax and you both are going to be there, do you hear me? You both! And you would be happy and smiley and you would not let my mother know any of this or I would have both your fucking brainless heads on a tray for my wedding day!” 

You nodded, your lips parted and your brows furrowed over your nose as she took deep breaths and gathered her blond hair on a ponytail. 

“And I will have a lime blossom tea, please.” 

You nodded and a second later you placed the tea in front of her, making another one for yourself before you sat down next to her. 

“You should probably have chicken too, otherwise you’d retain fluids and get more swollen. I mean, in between the celery meals.” 

She bursted out laughing. 

Wednesday night

You weren’t sure who was going to get there first but you just hoped for your sake Gemma had placed name tags on your seats so you didn’t have to go through the disappointment of seeing Harry sitting next to someone else. 

He was standing, not far from the table, when he saw you walking in. It must be true- what they said that women only became prettier when they were pregnant- because you looked like you just came out of a dream. You smiled timidly at those who greeted you and from his spot next to his cousins he could see you were sad and shy and somewhat still scared. He hated to see you like that- he wanted to change everything in the world so you would never be afraid again- but he also remembered it had been his job to make you feel safe and fearless- at least when it came about family- and he had failed you so he was very surprised when you made your way towards him without hesitation the moment your eyes met his. 

“Hello.” You smiled timidly. 

“Hi.” He smiled, relief washing over his very soul as soon as he heard your voice. 

“Is your mum here already?” 

So that was the reason you had come to him- so she wouldn’t know. 

“Yeah.” He nodded. 

Before he could say anything else, people started making their ways inside from the balcony and taking their seats on the long table. You looked at the plates- no tags, great. Harry was still standing next to you, probably fighting the same hesitation so you gave him a soft smile when you noticed how tensed his shoulders were. He was about to start sweating, you could tell, and he had been glancing timidly at you for the last two minutes so you decided to start the conversation. 

“Is this seat taken?” You smiled softly, pointing at an empty chair next to the one he was standing behind. 

“No.” He smiled. 

“Well can I sit next to you?” 

“You can always sit next to me.” He smiled. “Anywhere.” 

Dinner started and finished smoothly. Gemma had cried at least four times and Mike had made a toast for his father’s cat but other than that, dinner had started and finished smoothly. Harry had been taking small sips from his glass of wine, purposely bringing the glass to his lips so he could miss the refills while you had been casually sipping on your water, your wine glass untouched. He discreetly changed your wine glasses after he was done with his and you chuckled lightly as you realized how careful he was with every little detail, as if somebody would suspect of a pregnancy just because you weren’t having wine. He smiled. 

“Can we talk?” He asked. 

You simply nodded and followed him out to the balcony, where he took a seat on one of the empty tables. He had surely closed the whole hotel restaurant for his sister and you smiled as you took a seat next to him. Both of you watched the London lights from afar. 

“I am very sorry for doubting you.” He sighed. “I can’t believe I thought the baby wasn’t mine.” 

“Me neither.” You chuckled. 

“I’ve been thinking about a little girl just like you but even shorter” You swatted his arm, half amused at his teasing as he smirked “running down the hall and making everything into a mess.” 

“Just like her daddy then.” You teased and he rolled his eyes. “I hope he has your eyes though.” 

“I don’t.” He smiled, staring into your eyes with a smile on his face. “I’m really sorry.” 

“I know.” You nodded. “I’m sorry too, you know. I mean we’ve been together for two years now and God knows how insistent” you chose- instead of annoying as fuck so he swatted your arm because he knew what you meant “you’ve been with all that communication shit and the first important decision we have to take together I go and not even tell you about it.” You shook your head. “So I’m sorry about that.” 

“I’m sorry you felt like you couldn’t tell me.” He added.

“That’s not your fault.” You bit your bottom lip and he nodded. 

“You know I love you right?” He took your hand in his, caressing his thumb over the back of your hand as you gave him a sweet smile. “You’re the love of my life and” he chuckled when he caught the way your eyes sparkled at his words “I know you’re too good for me but that’s why I’ll spend every day of my life trying to make that up to you. I just… Listen I know sometimes things are hard between us, I travel a lot and you… You have to stay home so you can do your thing but for me there’s nothing in this world worth losing you so… If I have to give up anything, that chair you don’t really like, the house in LA,” he joked “my job… I would do that. I will do anything for you and our baby.” 

“I would never ask you to do that.” You frowned. “I don’t want you to. One of the reasons I fell in love with you was because of your passion for music. I will never stay in your way.” He nodded. He knew. “Listen” you sighed “I don’t know how my baby is going to be” You shrugged “Whether he’d be tall or short, nice or naughty, whether he’d have brown eyes or green, curly or straight hair… But what I do know is that they will have the best dad in the world.” 

He chuckled as he wiped away his tears and then he wrapped his arm around your shoulders and pressed a kiss to your temple, still softly crying after his forehead had rested on the top of your head. You whispered I love you and your breath his his chest. He knew he was the luckiest man alive. 

“You’re really having my baby.” He chuckled. 

“I am.” You grinned. 

“You, Y/N Y/L/N, are going to be the best mum in the world and I’m so lucky both of you are mine.” He smiled. 

“I’m terrified.” You giggled, tears streaming down your cheeks and he chuckled as he wiped them away, pressing soft pecks all over your face in between big smiles. 

“You don’t have to have my baby now if you don’t want to.” He whispered. 

“I just don’t wanna mess them up.” You giggled or sobbed- you were not sure what was going on inside your mind. 

“How could you possibly mess anyone up, love?” He pecked your nose. “This… This might not be the best time but, uh, if we decide it is the right time, I’ll just take a break” he shrugged “for a couple years but, really baby, you gotta trust me and you gotta talk to me and if you do not want to be a mum just yet or ever” he raised his eyebrows “that’s okay too. You know when I said there was nothing in this world worth losing you, I meant it so just… Don’t be afraid to think out loud with me. I won’t judge you, baby, I know this age gap we’ve never really talked about hasn’t been important to us so far but I guess if I think back about me being 21 and I think about having a baby then… Well, I don’t know if I would have wanted that.” 

“I mean it might not have been intentional” You started, raising your eyebrows but he was already smiling because he knew that look “but… I’ve also been thinking lately about a little one with curly hair and green eyes, I think we could name him Robin” His smile widened at your suggestion as he nodded “and… I also kind of like the idea of being possibly one of the youngest moms in school, I think it’d make me kind of cool.” You narrowed your eyes, pursing your lips and making him laugh. 

“Kind of cool? Are you gonna try to be one of those cool mums” his fingers drew the quoation marks on the air as you smiled “that embarrass their teenage sons when his mates are over by trying to talk about cool things because they’re still young?” 

“That was so Anne, wasn’t it?” You smiled. 

“Oh, boy, you will be one of those.” He shook his head. “Hey, bug, you’re lucky I’m here to help you with this one.” He whispered, his eyes burning your belly and you rolled your eyes. 

“I’m so happy it’s you.” You grinned, looking at him. 

“I’m happy it’s you too, lover.”

“I mean it might not have been intentional” You started, raising your eyebrows but he was already smiling because he knew that look “but… I’ve also been thinking lately about a little one with curly hair and green eyes, I think we could name him Robin” His smile widened at your suggestion as he nodded “and… I also kind of like the idea of being possibly one of the youngest moms in school, I think it’d make me kind of cool.” You narrowed your eyes, pursing your lips and making him laugh. 

“Kind of cool? Are you gonna try to be one of those cool mums” his fingers drew the quoation marks on the air as you smiled “that embarrass their teenage sons when his mates are over by trying to talk about cool things because they’re still young?” 

“That was so Anne, wasn’t it?” You smiled. 

“Oh, boy, you will be one of those.” He shook his head. “Hey, bug, you’re lucky I’m here to help you with this one.” He whispered, his eyes burning your belly and you rolled your eyes. 

“I’m so happy it’s you.” You grinned, looking at him. 

“I’m happy it’s you too, lover.”

title: Chapter one
body:
PREVIOUS PART                         -                              NEXT PART 

_________________

‘Good morning everybody it is now 8.22 am and we have a special guest for you today on the radio. It is the talented and beautiful YN!’ Nick announced on the radio. You were on the radio 1 breakfast show with Nick to promote your new album.

‘Hello.’ You said in the mic.

‘Hello YN, how are you?’ Nick asked. ‘I am really good, a bit tired, but good.’ You said.

‘Good to hear. So, new album coming up. What can we expect?’

‘Well the album has a bit of everything really. I didn’t stick to one genre, I just wrote songs that came naturally and the ones I loved the best just came on the album. It wasn’t like I wanted one type on ‘mood’ for the album.’

‘Your latest single ‘yellow’ is a big hit so I am sure the rest of the album is going to great too.’ Nick said and you thanked him.

‘Talking about your single, it is a bit of a love song, isn’t it?’

‘Yes, it is. It was a song that really just wrote itself and I am in love with it. It talks about love in a real way I guess and not in a way how everything is perfect.’

‘I need to ask this so I am very sorry but is the song about somebody in particular?’

‘I know people really want to know this stuff but I am sad to announce that the song isn’t about one person in particular. I wrote this song out of many experiences I had with love. The song doesn’t only talk about just my romantic history but also about friendship/ family.’

‘That’s great. We will be chatting with YN a little later but first some music. Here is YN’s latest single Yellow.’ Nick announced and muted the mics. You putted of your headphones and took a sip from your coffee.

‘I really am a big fan of your music.’ Nick said and you smiled. ‘Thank you so much, I am a fan of your show.’ You said and it was true. You may live in LA now but when you were in London last year with a couple of friends, you woke up to his show and you really enjoyed his humor. You often put on his show when you are home alone.

‘Aren’t you sad it is going to end?’ You asked, you knew tomorrow was his last breakfast show. ‘I am not quitting radio, I am just stopping to do the breakfast show and honestly I am not mad about not having to set an alarm.’ He said. You laughed and nodded. ‘Yeah I wouldn’t mind not having to set an alarm for a while either.’

‘Starting in 30 seconds.’ A producer called and you both went back to your sides of the table and putted on your headphones.

‘Good morning to those who just woke up, we are here with YN.’ Nick announced when the song was over.

‘Good morning everybody.’ You said.

‘YN, you are known for being quite active on Instagram, is social media something you really like?’ Nick asked.

‘Social media is a good way of connecting with people and I like Instagram because I love taking pictures. About me being very active, I just recently started being really active. I used to be scared about what I can and can’t post but I think I kind of figured it out.’ You said.

‘Aren’t you scared people are going to know too much?’ Nick asked.

‘No, like I just said I think I figured out a good balance between sharing but not oversharing. At the end of the day I show what I want you to see.’ You said.

‘You also give the most amazing captions and comments on your photos, they are just amazing.’ Nick said. You laughed and thanked him.

‘Before you walked in, I was like I want to be on this girls Instagram and see what she would caption it.’ Nick said with a laugh.

‘Well, we can take a picture and I will make your wish come true.’ You said the last part in a very posh English accent.

You took another break and talked some more about performing and writing songs. Before you knew the interview was done.

‘It was really nice to meet you.’ You said while getting up from your chair. ‘You too darling.’ Nick said and you gave each other a hug. ‘YN?’ Nick asked and you looked at him. ‘I am having this little dinner party tonight because tomorrow will be my last show. I would really like for you to come. If you are free?’ Nick asked and you smiled wide. You had an amazing time with Nick on the radio.

‘I would love to come.’ You said and you exchanged phone numbers.

You left the building and got a text from Nick already saying, ‘We are going to be great friends.’ You couldn’t help laughing because you knew he was right.

.

You were late and god do you hate to be late somewhere. The meeting you had to attend kept dragging on. You walked out of your taxi after paying and thanking the kind man and walked towards the restaurant. 30 minutes late. You had texted Nick that you were going to be late and he said they would wait for you to arrive. You were nervous because these are all people you don’t know and now they had to wait for their dinner because of you.

You walked in the restaurant and told the woman at the front that you were here for Nick Grimshaw. She took a menu and walked you to a seperate room in the restaurant. When she opened the door, the room was filled with chatter. There was a large table set in the middle of the room and their were about 20 people sitting around the table. The woman handed you the menu and walked back. You thanked her and took a deep breath before walking more into the room.

Nick noticed you and yelled ‘YN!’ which made everybody to stop talking and look at you. You smiled and walked to Nick. You handed him the present you got your assistant to get him. ‘Hi Nick.’ you said and he stood up to give you a hug. You looked at the rest of the table and said, ‘So sorry that you had to wait.’

‘Hey, we are all still alive so don’t worry about it.’ Nick said and added, ‘Guys this is YN, she is my new best friend so be nice otherwise I will kick your asses.’ You laughed and waved at the table. ‘You can sit down there.’ Nick said to you and pointed at a spot where there were two empty chairs. You went over to your place but said hello to everybody first, introducing yourself and getting all of their names. When you got to the empty chairs you looked and saw that there was a pink phone laying on one of those chairs, so you took place on the other one.

‘Let’s order, shall we?’ Nick said and everybody opened their menu, the chatter returning to the table. You opened yours and looked at all the choices the restaurant has.

‘So YN, I just want to say that I really like your new song.’ The girl next to you said, her name was Fiona and she was a colleague of Nick’s on the radio. ‘Thank you so much, Fiona. I really enjoy the breakfast show. I especially love your and Nick’s banter. Always puts a smile on my face.’ You said and she thanked you.

You were both talking about what you were going to order when you felt a presence next to you. Before you could look next to you, Nick said, ‘Ah how nice of you to join us again H.’

‘Shut up Nick.’ Harry said in a teasing tone and sat down next to you. Everybody went back to looking at their menus. Harry looked at you and extended his hand saying, ‘YN, right?’ You nodded and shaked his hand saying a ‘Nice to meet you.’

‘I am a big fan of the new song, it’s a real hit.’ He said and you laughed. ‘Thank you, I really enjoy your music too. The album is amazing.’ You said and Harry was about to say something when the waiter showed up asking what everybody wanted to eat.

‘Oh god, I don’t know what to take.’ You whispered to yourself. ‘I recommend the risotto, I always take it when I come here. It is the best thing to get.’ Harry said.

‘Okay but how do you know it is the best thing to get when you always order the same thing?’ You asked. He gave you a surprised smile ans said, ‘Touche, but why go away from something that you know is good.’ He said. ‘I like to try new things, makes life exciting.’ You said and ordered the risotto when the waiter looked at you.

‘I will take the summer pasta.’ Harry said and you looked at him. ‘Summer pasta?’ You asked and he looked at you. ‘Well you ordered the thing I recommended you, might as well follow your advice.’ He said and you smiled, shaking your head.

About 30 minutes later, your dinner arrived. The risotto looked really good and the smell just made you want to dig in right away. Harry’s pasta also looked really good. You took a bite from the risotto and couldn’t help but moan at the taste. Harry looked at you and said with a teasing smile, ‘Good right?’ You nodded, while taking another bite.

‘How’s the pasta?’ You asked. ‘It’s really good actually, really happy I took your advice.’ He said and you both ate in silence enjoying the taste of the amazing food.

The further the evening went the more noise their was in the room. Everybody was talking and drinking and just having fun really. You weren’t drunk but you could feel the alcohol in your body.

You and Harry were both laughing at something that happened to him a while back on stage. You had been talking to each other the whole night and you were really enjoying yourself with him.

You both left the restaurant at around 1 am, saying goodbye and going your separate ways. You had such a great time tonight with Harry and you had exchanged phone numbers during the evening.

Let’s say you really hope he would call to hang out again soon.

____________

MASTERLIST                         -                               NEXT PART

____________

SOO, chapter one…

Please let me know what you think of it, I really love to hear feedback.

trail.content:
PREVIOUS PART                         -                              NEXT PART 

_________________

‘Good morning everybody it is now 8.22 am and we have a special guest for you today on the radio. It is the talented and beautiful YN!’ Nick announced on the radio. You were on the radio 1 breakfast show with Nick to promote your new album.

‘Hello.’ You said in the mic.

‘Hello YN, how are you?’ Nick asked. ‘I am really good, a bit tired, but good.’ You said.

‘Good to hear. So, new album coming up. What can we expect?’

‘Well the album has a bit of everything really. I didn’t stick to one genre, I just wrote songs that came naturally and the ones I loved the best just came on the album. It wasn’t like I wanted one type on ‘mood’ for the album.’

‘Your latest single ‘yellow’ is a big hit so I am sure the rest of the album is going to great too.’ Nick said and you thanked him.

‘Talking about your single, it is a bit of a love song, isn’t it?’

‘Yes, it is. It was a song that really just wrote itself and I am in love with it. It talks about love in a real way I guess and not in a way how everything is perfect.’

‘I need to ask this so I am very sorry but is the song about somebody in particular?’

‘I know people really want to know this stuff but I am sad to announce that the song isn’t about one person in particular. I wrote this song out of many experiences I had with love. The song doesn’t only talk about just my romantic history but also about friendship/ family.’

‘That’s great. We will be chatting with YN a little later but first some music. Here is YN’s latest single Yellow.’ Nick announced and muted the mics. You putted of your headphones and took a sip from your coffee.

‘I really am a big fan of your music.’ Nick said and you smiled. ‘Thank you so much, I am a fan of your show.’ You said and it was true. You may live in LA now but when you were in London last year with a couple of friends, you woke up to his show and you really enjoyed his humor. You often put on his show when you are home alone.

‘Aren’t you sad it is going to end?’ You asked, you knew tomorrow was his last breakfast show. ‘I am not quitting radio, I am just stopping to do the breakfast show and honestly I am not mad about not having to set an alarm.’ He said. You laughed and nodded. ‘Yeah I wouldn’t mind not having to set an alarm for a while either.’

‘Starting in 30 seconds.’ A producer called and you both went back to your sides of the table and putted on your headphones.

‘Good morning to those who just woke up, we are here with YN.’ Nick announced when the song was over.

‘Good morning everybody.’ You said.

‘YN, you are known for being quite active on Instagram, is social media something you really like?’ Nick asked.

‘Social media is a good way of connecting with people and I like Instagram because I love taking pictures. About me being very active, I just recently started being really active. I used to be scared about what I can and can’t post but I think I kind of figured it out.’ You said.

‘Aren’t you scared people are going to know too much?’ Nick asked.

‘No, like I just said I think I figured out a good balance between sharing but not oversharing. At the end of the day I show what I want you to see.’ You said.

‘You also give the most amazing captions and comments on your photos, they are just amazing.’ Nick said. You laughed and thanked him.

‘Before you walked in, I was like I want to be on this girls Instagram and see what she would caption it.’ Nick said with a laugh.

‘Well, we can take a picture and I will make your wish come true.’ You said the last part in a very posh English accent.

You took another break and talked some more about performing and writing songs. Before you knew the interview was done.

‘It was really nice to meet you.’ You said while getting up from your chair. ‘You too darling.’ Nick said and you gave each other a hug. ‘YN?’ Nick asked and you looked at him. ‘I am having this little dinner party tonight because tomorrow will be my last show. I would really like for you to come. If you are free?’ Nick asked and you smiled wide. You had an amazing time with Nick on the radio.

‘I would love to come.’ You said and you exchanged phone numbers.

You left the building and got a text from Nick already saying, ‘We are going to be great friends.’ You couldn’t help laughing because you knew he was right.

.

You were late and god do you hate to be late somewhere. The meeting you had to attend kept dragging on. You walked out of your taxi after paying and thanking the kind man and walked towards the restaurant. 30 minutes late. You had texted Nick that you were going to be late and he said they would wait for you to arrive. You were nervous because these are all people you don’t know and now they had to wait for their dinner because of you.

You walked in the restaurant and told the woman at the front that you were here for Nick Grimshaw. She took a menu and walked you to a seperate room in the restaurant. When she opened the door, the room was filled with chatter. There was a large table set in the middle of the room and their were about 20 people sitting around the table. The woman handed you the menu and walked back. You thanked her and took a deep breath before walking more into the room.

Nick noticed you and yelled ‘YN!’ which made everybody to stop talking and look at you. You smiled and walked to Nick. You handed him the present you got your assistant to get him. ‘Hi Nick.’ you said and he stood up to give you a hug. You looked at the rest of the table and said, ‘So sorry that you had to wait.’

‘Hey, we are all still alive so don’t worry about it.’ Nick said and added, ‘Guys this is YN, she is my new best friend so be nice otherwise I will kick your asses.’ You laughed and waved at the table. ‘You can sit down there.’ Nick said to you and pointed at a spot where there were two empty chairs. You went over to your place but said hello to everybody first, introducing yourself and getting all of their names. When you got to the empty chairs you looked and saw that there was a pink phone laying on one of those chairs, so you took place on the other one.

‘Let’s order, shall we?’ Nick said and everybody opened their menu, the chatter returning to the table. You opened yours and looked at all the choices the restaurant has.

‘So YN, I just want to say that I really like your new song.’ The girl next to you said, her name was Fiona and she was a colleague of Nick’s on the radio. ‘Thank you so much, Fiona. I really enjoy the breakfast show. I especially love your and Nick’s banter. Always puts a smile on my face.’ You said and she thanked you.

You were both talking about what you were going to order when you felt a presence next to you. Before you could look next to you, Nick said, ‘Ah how nice of you to join us again H.’

‘Shut up Nick.’ Harry said in a teasing tone and sat down next to you. Everybody went back to looking at their menus. Harry looked at you and extended his hand saying, ‘YN, right?’ You nodded and shaked his hand saying a ‘Nice to meet you.’

‘I am a big fan of the new song, it’s a real hit.’ He said and you laughed. ‘Thank you, I really enjoy your music too. The album is amazing.’ You said and Harry was about to say something when the waiter showed up asking what everybody wanted to eat.

‘Oh god, I don’t know what to take.’ You whispered to yourself. ‘I recommend the risotto, I always take it when I come here. It is the best thing to get.’ Harry said.

‘Okay but how do you know it is the best thing to get when you always order the same thing?’ You asked. He gave you a surprised smile ans said, ‘Touche, but why go away from something that you know is good.’ He said. ‘I like to try new things, makes life exciting.’ You said and ordered the risotto when the waiter looked at you.

‘I will take the summer pasta.’ Harry said and you looked at him. ‘Summer pasta?’ You asked and he looked at you. ‘Well you ordered the thing I recommended you, might as well follow your advice.’ He said and you smiled, shaking your head.

About 30 minutes later, your dinner arrived. The risotto looked really good and the smell just made you want to dig in right away. Harry’s pasta also looked really good. You took a bite from the risotto and couldn’t help but moan at the taste. Harry looked at you and said with a teasing smile, ‘Good right?’ You nodded, while taking another bite.

‘How’s the pasta?’ You asked. ‘It’s really good actually, really happy I took your advice.’ He said and you both ate in silence enjoying the taste of the amazing food.

The further the evening went the more noise their was in the room. Everybody was talking and drinking and just having fun really. You weren’t drunk but you could feel the alcohol in your body.

You and Harry were both laughing at something that happened to him a while back on stage. You had been talking to each other the whole night and you were really enjoying yourself with him.

You both left the restaurant at around 1 am, saying goodbye and going your separate ways. You had such a great time tonight with Harry and you had exchanged phone numbers during the evening.

Let’s say you really hope he would call to hang out again soon.

____________
